characters: A CLOCK ON A NIGHT STAND
A FRONT DOOR OPENS TO REVEAL HARLEY
A BOTTLE OF WINE IS OPENED
JANE AND ADAM ATOP SIDE BY SIDE LADDERS
WATER RUNNING OUT OF A FAUCET
JANE WALKS QUICKLY THROUGH A FARMER'S MARKET ON HER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A late afternoon sky, a red tile roof and the Santa Barba coast line frame this party of old friends. A trio plays Brazilian music as guests carry drinks and nibble on dess

dialogues.speaker: ON A FOURSOME OF FRIENDS
dialogues.text: The Couple who live in this house, SALLY AND TED, drink champagne as they chat with their closest friends, JANE A JAKE. JANE is mid-fifties and has embraced that fact. She knows is not the new 40 and because of that, she is still descr by all who know her as beautiful. Everything about this woman's appearance screams "solid." The years have been good to JAKE. He's never lost his loo his killer smile, or his ability to charm. He lifts his glass of champagne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy happy happy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reminding him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Anniversary. Jake pauses, wryly turns to Jane, making her smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some things never change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought maybe you were drifting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was pausing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.... (sighs, raising his glass)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy... Anniversary. You two have led an extraordinarily blessed life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE(cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As long as I've known you both, you've always managed to somehow do everything entirely right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- That's so true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, honestly, how can it be thirty years!?!   When did we do that trip to Spain? (looks to Jane) It was for both of our what..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Fifteenth anniversaries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, that was a great trip... The Two Women exchange a quick look when a tall, ADORABLE YEAR OLD BOY joins the group, holding a bottle of beer. T is OLIVER, Sally and Ted's son. All four light up as Oliv puts his arm around his Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ollie, how was graduation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was fantastic. I can't believe I'm not in school anymore. When's Luke's graduation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (correcting him) It's in three days!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry!   I mean this week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are the girls going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can't wait.                                       Jane glances across the party and sees AGNESS, A FREE SPIRITED PRETTY WOMAN in her thirties, wearing a sarong o a bathing suit and walking directly toward them. She carr a slice of cake. Jane becomes instantly distracted and uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long is Luke home before he has to go back for work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Only a week...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, that's it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I hate it. Well... (Agness joins the group,                      standing next to Jake)                       Congrats again... (puts down her champagne) Great party...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're leaving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I have some (Agness hands Jake a piece of cake. Jane works hard at not appearing flustered) -- stuff I have to get done tonight for work... (to Jake & Agness) I'll see you two in New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely. Lookin' forward to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.    Well....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Jane, what are you wearing to                  the graduation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, a suit or dress, probably a suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fancy.    Okay. Jane smiles tightly, raises her eyebrows to Sally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you there, Janey.    Where are you staying again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're at The Park Regent. You said                  you were at The Four Seasons,                       right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. (to Agness) Where are we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're at The Park Regent too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hates    this) Oh. Good.     That'll be convenient, actually.     Okay, so, see you soon..              (waves    awkwardly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I'll walk you out. As they WALK AWAY, they HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Ted, do you think you can help us get Pedro into El Montecito for kindergarten?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) I thought it was sweet how well you and Jake were getting along. Felt like old times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, we know how to do this by now. It has been ten years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's crazy. Jane hugs Sally good bye, her eyes landing on Agness affectionately rubbing Jake's back.

dialogues.speaker: THE FRONT DOOR
dialogues.text: as it closes after Jane.

dialogues.speaker: ON JAKE
dialogues.text: and sees Jane is gone.

dialogues.speaker: TWENTY-THREE YEAR OLD GABBY
dialogues.text: in jeans and a tank top CARRYING A CARTON OF BOOKS, A YOG MAT AND A SMALL LAMP. Gabby is Jane and Jake's middle chi But unlike most middle children, this one has never suffe from being ignored. Not a possibility with Jane as your mother. We are:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house is modest and charming and sits on a few acres the lush green hills of Santa Barbara. Neat rows of vegetables dot the landscape. Gabby arrives at her already packed Prius, where her OLDE SISTER, LAUREN, 26, is trying to fit everything into the trunk. Lauren is more conservatively dressed than Gabby a has an air of maturity about her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabby, stop...you're never going to                       fit all this in... you can come                           back for the rest tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't come back t--- Gabby looks up to see HARLEY, LAUREN'S FIANCE, in a T-shi and over-the-knee gym shorts, lugging a huge suitcase dow the front path, a duffel strapped across his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God...that's all my clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sets the suitcase down as he sees an SUV heading to the house)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARLEY(cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, your Mom is home. She'll                         figure this out. The SUV pulls to a stop, Jane gets out. Gabby starts pull cartons out of her trunk to make room for her clothes. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabby, you're leaving now? I                           thought you were going in the morning? GABBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know but my friends are all there and they wanted me to come tonight. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But honey, it's gonna get dark soon. You can't see out the back window. It's Saturday night. People will be on the road drinking... LAUREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, she'll be there in a couple of hours, she'll be fine. GABBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'm leaving this stuff here. I'll be back for it in a few days. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want me to drive it down in the morning? (Gabby's BLACKBERRY                                BUZZES, she laughs,                               thumbs flying)                                    I could be there by lunch. We could go to that big Bed, Bath, and Beyond, buy kitchen stuff... Gabby,                    can you look up from that thing?? GABBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up) I got it covered, Ma. (to Harley) Hey gangsta, help me carry these... HARLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exhausted) Yep.... Gabby and Harley CARRY THE BOXES back into the house.   J seems worried as she watches them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAUREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, are you afraid to sleep in the                      house alone? JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you....? No! (Lauren looks doubtful) -- I'm not! One of you is always                         moving out...                                            (Gabby re-joins)                                     But I am wondering who I'm gonna watch The Hills with? GABBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (huge hug) Mamacita... I'm gonna miss you. Jane hugs her back, but is aware of not hugging too hard. Harley joins the group. GABBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Omigod. L.A.! Okay. I'm doing this. (walks to her car) Mom, you don't happen to know where Dad is, do you? I tried calling him to say goodbye... JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was at Sally and Ted's. HARLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was? How was that? You and them at the same --                                      (Jane turns to him)                                  -- not that it's in any way, any of                      my... was just...                                        JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- It was....                                            (notices both girls wait for her answer) -- whatever. It was fine. GABBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was her lunatic child there? JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) Not this time. Gabby, call me when                       you get there. Do NOT forget. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE(cont'd) (Gabby texts, deep in                                     convo )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will. I'll call you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knock `em dead, little one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And call us when you get there, too. And no texting and driving. Jane loves that Harley said that. Gabby gets in her car a starts off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puts his arm around Jane's shoulder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They grow up so friggin' fast. I hate it. Gabby pulls out of the driveway and out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should get a dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.     Goodbye you two.   Love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heading for their car and getting into the passenger seat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love you boss! As Lauren and Harley drive off,    Jane turns and looks a suddenly very empty nest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Woman's house. Books and art collected over years. Interesting, unexpected pieces of furniture. Jane kicks o her heels, now feeling short and alone. Deep breath!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cramped, but clearly a cook's kitchen.      The Kids have few glasses and plates on the island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane gathers them and as she rinses them at the sink, she suddenly and surprisingly feels very alone. She pauses, allows herself the moment, then forces herself to snap ou it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Jane's other home. A large, bright, bustling BAKERY/RESTAURANT. The bakery counter could rival any in Paris. Last year, The New York Times rated Jane's pain au chocolat the best in the United States. A line waits to g in. A very relaxed Jane is behind the busy counter, easily mo between her young staff. The atmosphere is efficient and friendly. Jane adjusts a few signs on the counter, then reaches ins the display case, pulling out a tray of muffins topped wi powdered sugar. She carries the tray to the open pass- through to the BUSY KITCHEN and calls to the head Baker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reynaldo... (nods to the muffins)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too much sugar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little bit.                                               Reynaldo nods as Jane hands him the tray. Jane notices a line waiting to get up to the bakery count Knowing what to do, Jane's staff has already set out cups coffee with lids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who wants coffee while they're waiting? Jane and the staff hand out the free coffee.

dialogues.speaker: JANE WALKS THE COUNTER
dialogues.text: refills a glass of water, checking on her customers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly to a Young                                   Employee)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check on table five, will you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Young Employee nods as Jane looks up and sees a MAN o the other side of the counter. They exchange polite hello when Jane notices PETER, tan and confident, approaching h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (all smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter! PETER joins ADAM, the man who stands across from Jane. Ad is handsome in a way that sneaks up on you. There's something reserved and refreshing about his demeanor. He holds rolled blueprints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane, I can't remember, have you                          ever met Adam Schaeffer?

dialogues.speaker: JANE ADAM
dialogues.text: No.                             Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well....                                                  (shrugs awkwardly )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look what we've got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raises the blueprints)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your plans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Peter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So excited!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A farmhouse table almost fills the room. On the walls, posters for Jane's two cookbooks, framed food photos and few reviews. Jane, Peter, and Adam sit around the table as Adam rolls the blueprints in front of Jane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (before she looks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been thinking about this addition for ten years.                                   Peter and Adam watch as Jane's eagle eye examines the pla

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh, uh-huh. Oh, niiice....I like this wall of windows, Peter. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was Adam actually. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. (still perusing, then to Peter) Love where you put the stairs. That's so good! PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam's idea... Did she hear that? JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, the kitchen! Finally -                       I have a real kitchen with four                         walls... It's...oh, wow...you                           actually understood what I wanted! Jane looks to Peter with enormous appreciation.   Peter l to Adam. PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All Adam.                                               Jane turns to Adam. ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm happy you like it. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally noticing him)                              Okay. Hi.                                               (shakes his hand) ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) Hello. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You read all my e-mails. ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All 47 of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane smiles as her Office Manager sticks her head in the door. OFFICE MANAGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane, it's 10:15. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is? (rises) Oh, sorry, I have a 10:30... dentist. Can you leave these and I'll make a few notes? Well, actually, I have one tiny note now. (to Adam, re: plan) In my bathroom...um...no his and her sinks. ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, sure. No his?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just hers. ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you don't think in the future you might want a his? JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God, we're talking code about my life, right? ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) No, no, didn't mean to be. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truth is, in my current                              bathroom, I have two sinks and                           sometimes the other sink makes me feel bad. ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One sink. Not a problem. Can we schedule a meeting for next week? Does Tuesday work for you?                               JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuesday's great. Eight-thirty too                        early? At the house? ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way too chic for a dentist's office. Jane sits nervously a chair in a well styled, well upholstered examination ro The door opens quickly and a handsome, crisp looking DOCT ENTERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. I'm Dr. Moss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Jane Adler. So, I just wanted to start with... and please don't take this the wrong way but I'm the type of person who kind of makes fun of people who get plastic surgery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do? Good, because, you know, some women can look a little fake                         and plasticky. And in my opinion -- worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I agree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's good, so, well, as against the whole thing as I am, I do have a problem that's been bugging me. My left eyelid is really saggy. I find I'm sometimes holding it up when I'm watching TV or reading and I was wondering if that's something you could fix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at her closely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's resting on your eye lashes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (measures her lids with a very tiny ruler)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually you have the same amount of excess skin on both sides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do? Well, I'm only interested in fixing one eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane, what you need to fix this is a brow lift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A brow lift? Wh-what is that exactly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We surgically cut at your hair line. Incision goes right across                       here.                                                  (demonstrates on himself by indicating a line drawn like a headband)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we just lift the skin up a little tighter across the skull. (Jane nods, already hating this)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We staple it back in place right above your ears. Recovery isn't all that bad but you could be fairly numb and you'll probably                        have a headache that lasts anywhere from say 3 to 6 months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane flies into the elevator, out of breath and a little nauseous. She taps on the Lobby button.   The elevator mo down. PING. The DOORS OPEN and Jane looks into an empty hallway, facing a SIGN that reads, Santa Barbara Fertilit Center. Helping Couples Become Parents. Jane hears someone is about to get on the elevator, steps back toward the corner. A messy looking 5 YEAR OLD BOY dashes in. Jane recognizes him. She looks up and Jake and his wife, Agness, in oversized dark shades and a long bla dress (very Angelina Jolie) get on the elevator, obviousl mid-argument.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agness' mood seems very dark today. They instantly shut u when they realize Jane is in the elevator. AGNESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane! JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Hey..                                                JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiii. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. AGNESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pushing the Lobby button, mumbles) -- Perfect. PEDRO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake, Jake, Jake, Jake. Jake. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on Pedro, I'm talking to someone. Pedro sits on the floor, crashing into the back wall of t elevator. AGNESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pedro, up! Now!!                                        (she snaps) Jane unconsciously holds up her left eyebrow. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing in this building? JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dentist. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't go to Sharon anymore? JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, no... changed. Jane looks at the fertility literature in Jake's hand jus Jake slips it behind his back. An awful two seconds of silence, then Jane notices a tattoo of a tiger on Agness' back. It creeps her out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake catches Jane's reaction, then thank God the doors op Jake leans down and picks up Pedro who instantly climbs u his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, don't do that.. 11   As they all EXIT THE ELEVATOR, Pedro has now made hi to Jake's shoulders. Think chimpanzee. Agness' cell RINGS and as she answers it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- See you in the Big Apple.                           Pedro is now resting on Jake's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to be nonchalant                           with a kid on his head,                           smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane and THREE OF HER GIRLFRIENDS are mid-meal. The wine flowing and the women are laughing. TRISHA has happily ne been married. JOANNE is widowed and DIANE is divorced. Th are all Jane's age and have been friends forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is beyond....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- When the three of them got in                       the elevator... between that and                       the staples and the headache for six months... it was the most                          insane hour of my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Jake has lost his mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. First of all, he was a complete prick for cheating on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, can't disagree with that.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: And then he marries her... a known lunatic.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: She has a big job.

dialogues.speaker: TRISHA
dialogues.text: Why do you always say that?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Because she does. She runs the whole marketing department at KY, whatever that station's called so she's not that big of a lunatic.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Janey, come on, he cheats on you with her, your 20 year marriage ends then six months later she leaves Jake for some random guy, has a baby, leaves that guy, marries Jake and she's not nuts?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: (groans) Jo, you're so lucky Jerry's dead.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNE
dialogues.text: Oh, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: No, I mean, you never have to bump into him.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNE
dialogues.text: That's true.

dialogues.speaker: TRISHA
dialogues.text: (rises to get more wine) Janey, you want to meet a guy I met on Match.com that I didn't like?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Gee, what a great offer.   I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: TRISHA
dialogues.text: He wasn't that awful.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Oooo. Sounding better every minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trisha stops at Jane's seat, refilling Jane's wine glass. TRISHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know it's not healthy not to have sex for...however long it's                      been...                                               JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me... I'm not not doing it on purpose. DIANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I don't know if this is true,                   but I read on line about this woman who hadn't done it in so long her vagina closed up. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!!!    Get out of here. All the Women SCREAM. DIANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear to God. It grew back together. JOANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Was it ever one piece? DIANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I know is, she had to have a vaginaplasty. TRISHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ouch!!!!                                              JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my Goddddddd. Jane flops over on the table, laughing, resting her head. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lifts her head, then talks as if she's in the doctor's office) "Dr. Moss, Hi. I have a little situation that needs fixing...." TRISHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bubbee, you want to fix your situation? Just date someone. Seriously. Anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jane takes that in, we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA BOOMS DOWN ON Park Avenue to find Jane, the Girls Harley, just out of a Cab. The Bellman is taking their luggage as the Girls spot their brother, LUKE, heading to them. Lauren and Gabby run to Luke, hug him, commenting on his hair, his shoes, his jeans, his tan. Jane lights up when sees her son, hugs him incredibly hard, kisses his cheek, then another tight squeeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love when we're all in the same time zone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all cross THROUGH THE LOBBY toward the RECEPTION DES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what's up Luke?      Did you decide to have the party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah.    Big time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you guys gonna sleep over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you give us your bed and change the sheets. They arrive at THE RECEPTION DESK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're having a party? When? (to Reception Clerk)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Adler. Two rooms...hopefully next to each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RECEPTION CLERK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have an Adler, J. in a Superior Suite, Park Avenue view. Oh, I'm              sorry, here it is. Adler J -- two Standard Doubles. Sorry about                 that. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we're not the ones in the Superior Suite. Have the other                Adlers checked in yet? Just wondering. RECEPTION CLERK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, they haven't, ma'am. Not yet.             Now I just need a credit card and             your signature. As Jane takes out her credit card... LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Mom, is it okay if the girls come with me now and help me set up? HARLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And by girls he means the three of us. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Hold on. Set up what? I have reservations for all of us for dinner. That's not happening now? LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Me and my friends are having this huge thing at our apartment and the girls said they'd help us set up.. (sees her disappointment) We're going to be together all day tomorrow. GABBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Mom, it's his last night before graduation. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay.    Do you want me to help or...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (super sweetly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Love your credit card....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane rides the elevator carrying both girls' jackets and carry ons as well as her own. Just as the doors are about close, a Good Looking Couple in their early forties gets As they go up. The Guy has his hand around the woman's waist, his fingers fanning her butt. The Couple looks at each other, smiling privately. Jane looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two double beds. Jane lies on top of one of the beds, ful dressed, shoes off, eyes wide open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane ENTERS the hotel's posh bar/restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Host)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Adler. One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Your table's almost ready Mrs. Adler. Would you like to wait at the bar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to read upside down reservation list)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. You don't happen to have another Adler coming in, do you? Adler for two?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (perusing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... You're our only Adler this evening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relieved)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: THE BAR
dialogues.text: Jane takes a seat next to Two Hot Younger Women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bartender) Pinot Noir, please. No, you know                       what? I'll have a Tanqueray Martini                    very dry with a twist.                                 Jane strums the bar top, checks out the room. It's fun be in a big city. Her martini arrives, she takes a sip and HEARS something very familiar. Jake's laugh. She looks across the bar and sees Jake talking to the bartender. He seems to be alone. Jane waves. Jake notices her and smile JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your....?? Jake picks up his drink and carries it to the bar stool n to Jane. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pedro got the stomach flu so I'm flying solo. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Didn't know you knew how to be by yourself. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any chance you could just go easy on me? Just a one night free pass. (noticing her) You look good, Janey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah....                                               JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do. You always do.   Your hair's shorter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like it. The Host joins them. HOST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Adler, your table's ready. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want some company, Mrs. Adler?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane gives Jake a doubtful look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- We both have to eat. (sees Jane is hesitating)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When's the last time we ate a meal together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinks for a sec)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just the two of us? Alone?      1999.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, come on. Once every ten years.

dialogues.speaker: A HALF HOUR LATER
dialogues.text: New drinks arrive for Jane and Jake. Physically, they're sitting as close as they've been in a decade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...how are things in the fertility world?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checks watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe it took you this long to bring that up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying not to laugh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sperm issues?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apparently. Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A baby?! Really Jake? So...the next time you go to a graduation, you'll be what? Fifty-eight plus... (tries to do the math)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I think the number you're looking for is 79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.     So. Seriously, how is that good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are we talking about this? I thought we were going to have fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you get that idea?

dialogues.speaker: A BOTTLE OF WINE IS OPENED
dialogues.text: and poured. The bar has filled up and Jane and Jake are sitting a little closer together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Just tell me, how long were you seeing him for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, please, it was five years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know but I always wondered so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little jealous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man's married now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care. How long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not long.

dialogues.speaker: A23 LATER
dialogues.text: The bar is now crowded. Jane and Jake are finally eating still drinking. Jake is telling Jane a long story and she can't stop laughing.

dialogues.speaker: BRANDY TIME
dialogues.text: A DJ spins for the after dinner crowd. Couples dance on t dance floor. Jane and Jake both react to the song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This song reminds me of your                           birthday party... the one in our                       old house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Oh, yeah. That was such a fun                       night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So fun. You wore that white halter                     dress....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (remembering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeahhhh....                                        (remembering it all, looks                         at Jake with a longing                            for her own past...)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want to dance?

dialogues.speaker: THE DANCE FLOOR
dialogues.text: Jake and Jane are dancing...it's familiar yet with the bl of the new. Something's going on here. Jake starts singin Jane joins in. This is by far, the loosest we've seen her Of course, it helps that she's drunk. They dance around o another without inhibition. A mating dance....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (astonished, laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're married to someone else...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about it! They both laugh then Jake pulls Jane close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sexy....)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.... I know you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking deeply into her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I know you....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're in bed and they've done it. They're not even entirely undressed. They're spent, sweaty, breathing heavily. Jake cups his hand on Jane's vagina, gives it a solid pat and hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home sweet home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh......God......... Jane covers her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was one crazy ride...thought we were going to break the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not looking good)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I'm having an out of body experience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Totally. You're so great, Janey. I forgot how great. Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please shut up.    I'm so dizzy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the pilates are payin' off by the way. Jane moans, OPENS THE NIGHT TABLE DRAWER, leans over and throws up into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no! Jane woozily sits up on her side of the bed, her back to Jake. Jake looks over at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starting to rise)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look the other way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Cause I have to get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane...I know what you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look the other way Jake!!! As Jake turns away, Jane runs to the bathroom, carrying a pillow covering her bare ass. Jake hears her throw up aga He winces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane sits on the floor, by the toilet, looking wiped out. Jake gingerly steps into the bathroom, hair a mess, weari boxer shorts and his unbuttoned shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up at him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAT is wrong with us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? This was amazing. We just had a great time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A great time? This is the dumbest thing two people have ever done. (giant moan.... )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake sits on the edge of the tub.    This is news to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? I don't know.... I haven't thought it out, but off the top of my head I'd say it was smokin' hot so something about it wasn't so dumb. (she stares up at him, sick as a dog)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, FYI, I like that you stopped getting bikini waxes. You've gone native. I was into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horrified, Jane lets out a yelp on her way to throwing up again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NYU Band plays Pomp and Circumstance as the Graduatin Class of `09 ENTERS THE FIELD in caps and gowns. All the families in the bleachers are on their feet, applauding.

dialogues.speaker: THE ADLERS
dialogues.text: Jane, in sunglasses, is sobbing, taking photos. Next to h are Gabby, Harley and Lauren, hooting, clapping and screaming, "There he is!!!" And next in line is Jake mann the video camera, wiping away tears. ON THE FIELD, Luke spots his gang in the bleachers and gi a broad bow. The Adlers go crazy, especially Jane, who does a finger whistle. Jake looks over at Jane with puppy dog eyes. The girls notice, assuming their Dad is emotional over the ceremony. Jane feels Jake's glare but won't dare look ove at him. Gabby nudges her Mom to look over at Dad. Jane turns his way, sees that look in his eyes and starts to b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Family celebrates over lunch. Luke is telling a funny story about something that happened on stage at graduatio Jane is the only one not fully chiming in and laughing. S can't seem to move beyond what happened last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   Totally.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE TABLE
dialogues.text: Jake slips off his shoe and rubs his foot up Jane's leg a under her skirt.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Jane jumps, quickly turning it into a reaction to Luke's story. She gives Jake a private stare that says, "stop or I'll kill you."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would like to propose a toast to your Mother. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (what???) To me? JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've done my part with you guys, but Jane... you -- very talented you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God... JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabby, I'm serious. Jane, you did                 a magnificent job, as you always do... The Kids look at one another...what's this about? JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I look at the three of you beautiful kids...all grown up, I think of all the work your mother did, much of it without my help... (starts to well up) LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude...pull it together. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Janey, I take my hat off to you. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Jake. Thank you. Out of nowhere, sudden appreciation. But thank you. Really. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not totally out of nowhere, Jane...if you know what I mean. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly) Which I don't...but... LAUREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Have no idea. Let's move on,                           shall we?                                                 Jane holds up her droopy left eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to say something too. For real. No offense to the lovely Agness or her charming offspring... (the Kids stifle laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Not nice. Harley stops laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I'm sorry. But I just want to say I really loved today, just being with the original five... (Luke nods in agreement)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- plus Harley, but he's like one of us. I don't think we've ever done this before... Had a meal together. And hung out like this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean other than the first 13 years of your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what's she saying. It's been awesome....just for a whole day to be just... us. They all reflect on that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Adlers are at the Reception Desk. Jane and Jake are n to each other, signing their credit card receipts, the Ki chat behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jane)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something feels right in the universe again, doesn't it? Jane looks at him but doesn't answer.    She turns to the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So who's coming home when?   No one's told me the details. Jake's CELL RINGS. Jane half listens to his conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into cell) Hey. (turns away) How's Pedro feeling? Distracted, Jane focuses on Lauren. LAUREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (responding to "Pedro") Okay, we're gonna help pack Luke up, the three of us leave day after tomorrow and Luke's home the end of the week. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rejoins, finishing his call) -- I will. Call you when I land.                      (slips cell away, not missing a beat) Janey, what flight are you on? JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on the uh, the four o'clock.                      JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, too bad. I'm on the five                          o'clock. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's nuts, why don't you try to get on the same flight? JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I could try. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been...great, but let's not ... push it. LAUREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was just trying to be nice. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Okay, I've got to hit the                     road, guys.                                           (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE(cont'd) (kisses each kid as they line up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for staying. So proud of you. Be good. Call me if you need me.                                                      (she arrives at Jake, pauses, speechless)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kisses her cheek)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was really fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (painfully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was.

dialogues.speaker: A TREE LINED MONTECITO LANE
dialogues.text: We are looking THROUGH A WINDSHIELD and listening to a SE HELP BOOK ON TAPE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Just follow a few basic rules to make your divorce a less hurtful one by breaking the cycle of conflict.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Accept your ex, for who she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very big ho.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And try to remember when you fell in love and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (spotting something)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- There she goes...

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: jogging right past his car, listening to her iPod. ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane! She doesn't hear him. Adam backs up next to her. Jane slo down. Adam lowers the passenger window. She looks in, doesn't recognize him at first. ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Adam...                                             JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's 8:30 Tuesday morning! ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we still okay? JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! Totally forgot! I'm so sorry! Can you give me a lift back to the house? ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly cleaning up the front seat) Sure...come on in. Jane GETS INTO THE CAR just in time to hear: MALE NARRATOR (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- But perhaps the most important lesson in going through your divorce is to learn to forgive. Forgiveness is the key to-- Adam hits the CD KNOB to turn the CD OFF, but instead he accidentally FAST FORWARDS. MALE NARRATOR (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In spite of your hurt feelings, prove to her that you can be a mature-- Adam HITS THE KNOB again and this time, turns it OFF, a b mortified. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just getting a divorce?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two and a half years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wooo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embarrassed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been a process.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the good news. In two more years you'll actually begin to feel normal again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In two more years I'll begin to feel normal? Why am I having trouble seeing that as good news?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe that was just my experience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, I hope so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue prints are spread on a garden table.   Adam is drawi Jane watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- So if we move this wall back a                        bit, that can bring the arch                             forward, which is where you really                       want it, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I'd love that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sketching)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have an idea... what if we move                        my bedroom like six or eight feet                        so I can get more of the morning                         light?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE(cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sees Adam hesitate) Not possible? ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Yes, but you'll wake up in the                      morning, open your bedroom door and fall 12 feet into your kitchen. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh! Forgot it was all open up there! ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I get where you're headed.                         Let me see what I can do... This                       property is so great... Have you                       lived here a long time? JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About ten years. I bought this                         place right after my divorce but                       it's taken me until now to be able                     to finally do this....                                 Jane and Adam are distracted when a Porsche noisily pulls and Jake gets out wearing a suit and a chipper attitude. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning! (to Jane) Am I interrupting...? JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thrown that   he's here) Hi. No, well, we   were just about                     done. Adam, this   is my ex-husband,                   Jake. Jake, this   is Adam Schaeffer,                  my architect. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (they shake hands) Good to meet you. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: plans) Can I take a look?   Do you mind? Adam looks to Jane for approval but too late, Jake's alre looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's not 100% worked out yet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. You're finally getting the kitchen you always wanted...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huge bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not huge.                                            (suddenly insecure)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't I show these to you when we get a little closer. Jane starts to roll up the blueprints, fumbles a little. Adam finishes for her. She thanks him with her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I think next we should stake out the addition... see how it all                        feels - size wise...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll e-mail you and we'll set it                          up. We did good work today. Jake,                         nice meeting you. Jake smiles and waves as Adam exits, walking to his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns to Jane)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got time for a cup of coffee? Adam can't help but sneak a look back at them.   Jane wav bit embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane moves nervously around the kitchen, opening the frid taking out juice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why haven't you returned any of my calls or e-mails? JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake, come on. This is just too weird. We have to just never do what we did - ever again. You're             an adulterer and I'm an awful person, basically. I haven't slept in days. What we did was just so wrong on so many levels. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it was so right on a couple of levels too. Admit it. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally settles) No! It wasn't! On no levels was it right! JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't say we didn't enjoy each other's company. Sitting at the bar, dancing...after dancing... (she doesn't want to be reminded) Come on, you and I haven't had fun like that in a hundred years.                JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! Because we're not supposed to have fun like that! We're divorced!   Are you like, what? Unhappy at home?   Does she not "understand" you? Did you just               want to know what it would be like with someone my age? What is this? JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd be lying if I said I never think about you, Janey. I think about you. A lot. And no, it's not perfect at home. Obviously. Look at me. I've got three grown kids and I'm going to kindergarten interviews. I'm a walking cliche. Jane shrugs.   She agrees.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: And I can't, literally can't stop thinking about what happened in New York. Fate brought us together once, maybe it happened again. (she pauses...) And I know... you've moved on with            your life, I get it, but you can't deny something real and honest happened that night. Can't we just go with it, see where it takes us. No one has to know. (Jane shudders) You were so great. So loose and sexy. How often do you get to be like that?    You can run and open restaurants and build your perfect kitchen but what about having someone to hold you in the middle of the night...?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Not high on my list these days.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: But what if that someone is someone who's known you since you're 23 and loved you for most of your life.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: I forgot what a good lawyer you are.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Give this a shot, Janey.... Life is           short and it's tough. Don't discount what we have with each other. (he's getting to her) You know what they say... people in nursing homes who have plants live longer than the people without plants.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Oh, so you're saying you think this           is a healthy choice for me?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Honey, I know it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the plants get watered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane and Jake have done it again. In broad daylight and sober. They catch their breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God, it's official.    We're having an affair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you need to label                                 everything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because that's what this is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, in its crassest form, maybe, if we were two other people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just because we were married for 19 years does not not make this an affair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, but since we were together for so long, it's not really that wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? You want to run that logic by your wife? Jane fans herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do me a favor, you're on my side. Can we switch? I feel disoriented.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when is this your side?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since ten years ago.   Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They switch sides. In the middle of this maneuver Jake la on top of Jane. He pauses. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could I interest you in a little... JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! They flop onto the opposite sides of the bed.    Jane fan herself. So hot. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns to her) Why do you think the sex is so much sexier this time? JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Jane pulls the sheet up.   They look at one another. He g her to smile. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've gotta get to work. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too. Okay... (moans as he sits up, then                             rises) Jake starts to get dressed. Jane watches him from bed, checking out his stomach. He notices. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating his belly) See what happens when you're not looking out for me. (pats it) She lets me eat everything.. pasta, cream cheese... JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you hand me my robe? Jake reaches for Jane's robe, hands it to her.   She indi Jake should turn around. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do I have to..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Because the last time you saw me standing up naked I was in my forties. (Jake can't believe this) Things look different lying down. Just... Jake rolls his eyes, turning away from her. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've gotten a little nuts. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slipping into her robe) Jake, I think it would be really good for us to not talk for a few days. Okay?                                   JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning back to her) You know what I think -- just for the record? I think we're doing something kinda brilliant. All the things that tore us apart aren't issues anymore. I'd say our problems actually went away. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What..?                                       JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't you always say you felt you weren't being heard? Wasn't that our big issue -- both of us always feeling rejected and unappreciated. Look at us now. You're so much more together, you're not exhausted all the time, you're not catering every weekend and busy all day with the kids and I'm calmer, less obsessed about work. I'm a partner. I'm there. We grew into the people            we wanted each other to be! And I             don't know... I appreciate things about you I couldn't even see before. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not wanting to get into it) Really? (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE(cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you know, I'm not as good as you at remembering all the details of our...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting dressed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Do you remember never having time for sex? Now look at us. We've already done it two times this week and it's only Tuesday. I swear to God, if half the couples who got divorced, could get back together 10 years later, their problems would be solved. I think we're on to something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not sure I agree and...also, we're not back together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I know other divorced people think about this...they wonder - what if.... (fixes his tie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think this is very French of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is this French of us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a young wife but I'm having sex with my old wife. Not old, you know. Ex! (Jane nods....)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean old... 39   Jane tosses Jake his jacket. They EXIT the BEDROOM a toward THE FRONT DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're doing that thing where you act like you're not listening... but think about what I'm saying, okay? (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any of your homemade granola here? I haven't had it in so long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You miss it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We sell it for $6.50 a bag at the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, why give it away when you can... (Jane OPENS the front door and moves him outside)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiss good bye? Jane kisses him on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wants to be courted! (as he heads for his car)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can do that! (turns back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And honey, thanks for the.... (indicates sex with his fingers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Coffee.... Jane can't close the door fast enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane carries three beautiful homemade pies, arriving in T LIVING ROOM where her Friends are gathered. Platters of f and open bottles of wine are on the coffee table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, now what?   Three pies?!                    This is a feast!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what's going on, I have so much energy lately which I think is probably a result of... all the sex I'm having. (the Ladies LAUGH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'm actually not kidding. I'm having an affair. (They stare at her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a married man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? When did this happen? Where'd you meet him? JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it... started in New York. DIANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In New York??? Last week? JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we did it once there and once here. Maybe more than once there, I was drunk so... TRISHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had drunken sex with a married man in New York when you went for Luke's graduation? JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs, embarrassed) Turns out I'm a bit of a slut. (re: pies) Apple, Blueberry or Plum?                     DIANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, wait, wait. Hold on....                 You're not saying!!!! JOANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clueless) -- What? TRISHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (catching on) No! You're not! JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God, but I am. I'm having an affair with Agness Adler's husband. The Women all SCREAM as Jane fans herself. TRISHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That. Is. Genius! JOANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But also sort of wrong. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Oh, please. Not that wrong.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: I know! I'm so happy to be able to tell someone. This is the most out            of control thing I've ever done.              Literally. You know me.

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: Yes we do. You don't do anything wrong, or bad. Ever. So you're                allowed this one. I'm sorry ... I kinda love it.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNE
dialogues.text: He was yours first.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: True. Not that I want him back by the way.

dialogues.speaker: TRISHA
dialogues.text: Of course not. You can do better than Jake.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: (a little insulted) Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: TRISHA
dialogues.text: I mean you've outgrown him. You've blossomed, you feng shuied your whole life... Just please, don't let him talk you into saving him.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: I won't... (wonders what that means)

dialogues.speaker: DIANE
dialogues.text: There is something kinda perfect about this. You don't have to cook for him or clean up after him or actually even sleep with him....

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I have an Ex with benefits...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, girls, what about the fact that I'm now the other woman? I'm the one we hate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, forget that.    Agness is still                     the one we hate.    Even in this scenario.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, karma is the ultimate bitch on this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane walks through the busy kitchen holding a sheet of pa Her shirt is a little more fitted. Her make up, a little prettier. She crosses to the head Baker who's just taking tray of cookies out of the oven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reynaldo, I'm changing the breakfast menu, want to give it a little more life... (shows it to him, he seems                          distracted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distracted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- What'd you do? Something to your hair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something about you looks different. Little more "caliente."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caliente? Another Chef in the kitchen nods in agreement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see it Eddie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever it is, it's workin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He winks at Jane as he stirs cookie batter.    Jane blush her cell phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. (listens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I didn't do this again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA MOVES IN on Adam, waiting by a ladder in the middl the field. Jane's addition is staked out with orange tape

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: Rushing toward Adam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam, I'm so sorry.   My mind is just... Forgive me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I were your shrink I'd say maybe you don't really want to build this house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's completely not true.   I'm really sorry. (looks at taped off addition)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! I like it already!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's feeling really good. So,                      this becomes your office. We come                        down your new hallway, the windows                       are all along here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Love it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And from here to there...wait, let                       me get the door for you...                               (opens a piece of tape)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your kitchen.                                            (they ENTER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in the eating area. How's                          the size? (pretends to sit)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're at either end of the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs at Adam)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feels perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought so too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking it all in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is heaven!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna be cool.    Want to go                        upstairs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So if you were lying in bed, this would be your view. Jane breaks into a smile.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE DISTANCE
dialogues.text: Over this tranquil view -- A CELL RINGS. Jane takes her phone out of her pocket, sees it's Jake calling. She paus then pushes "IGNORE" and then promptly loses her balance. Adam immediately reaches over and steadies her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabs her heart)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water is running in the sink, even though no one's at the sink. Jake is in the shower stall, fully dressed, putting away his cell. He quietly pushes the shower door open and then carefully shuts it with a small snap. Jake fake coug and then turns off the sink water. He checks his watch wh he hears GLASS BREAKING in another room then hears Agness calling his name in anger. He leaps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming! Jake quietly UNLOCKS THE BATHROOM DOOR and EXITS to find path is blocked by Pedro who sits on a tricycle staring u him. PEDRO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you doing in there? JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going to the bathroom. PEDRO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The toilet didn't flush. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes it did. PEDRO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why were you in the shower with your clothes on? JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (making sure Agness doesn't hear) What are you talking about? PEDRO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard the shower door close. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you have, x-ray ears? Agness joins in briefs and a white tank, black bra peekin through. She holds a broom. AGNESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up Pedro? PEDRO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake took a shower with his clothes on. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pedro!    Darling...                                    AGNESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he talking about? JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't speak Pedro.   That's your department.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Pedro)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go in the kitchen, P, I broke something. (to Jake, annoyed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo. Can you help? Agness EXITS back to the kitchen as Pedro stares at Jake.

dialogues.speaker: TWO GORGEOUS CROQUE-MONSIEURS
dialogues.text: These open-faced fancy French Grilled Cheese Sandwiches a carried to Jane's counter. We're:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane very professionally places the Croque-Monsieurs onto waiting plates, adds some salad on the side. Adam stands nearby with a glass of wine, jacket off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That looks amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called a croque-monsieur. It's one of the first things I learned to make when I lived in Paris because the ingredients are really really cheap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did you live in Paris?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my early twenties. I went there to take a six day pastry class and ended up staying a year working as an apprentice in a bakery.                               Jane places the plates AT THE ISLAND as she and Adam SIT BY SIDE. Jane raises her wine glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for taking my 47 e-mails                       and turning them into something so                       beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are rapidly becoming one of the                    most appreciative clients I've ever                    had...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm not all that used to                         being able to count on anyone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised by that)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE DRIVING
dialogues.text: He squints, looking ahead, SEES:

dialogues.speaker: JANE'S HOUSE
dialogues.text: And Adam's car parked out front. Jake turns OFF HIS HEADLIGHTS, slowly pulling around to the side of the hous

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it's none of my business but... I'm trying to figure out why someone like you is divorced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what'd you come up with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something in the you're too nice department..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, that and my wife fell in love with my best friend. Ex-best                           friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were all on a biking trip, he                       and his wife, me and my wife...through Tuscany and on the last day of the trip they announced they were in love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's awful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   Not a great plane ride home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can imagine, sitting there for eleven hours with your wife who you know is -- oh, that's rough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually they went on to Venice and I flew back with Carol, his wife. You can't imagine what it's like to                      sit next to someone who's been                           crying for ten straight hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't blame her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was talking about me. Anyway, they're married now and it's pretty much an ongoing awful thing. But, you and your ex... When I saw him stop by for a cup of coffee the other morning, I thought -- Wow!                         That's the way it's supposed to be.                      You two seem to have it all figured out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not as figured out as you'd think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake, in work-out clothes, sprints across the front lawn, careful not to be seen.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Jane clears their dishes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I hope you don't feel I've been interrogating you, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE(cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what it's like to have your ex remarried and to not have so much going on in that department. I mean, do you date ever or...                            ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, constantly actually. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Constantly? ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone I know or have ever known has fixed me up. And then, sometimes I just meet women, I don't know how that happens, but... JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- But no girlfriend? ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet. Jane stands ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE ISLAND and hands Ada another croque-monsieur. She stays on her side, like a waitress at a counter. She refills his water glass. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like to date... ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I find it really stressful. You know, the last time I was in the dating world was 1978.                       It's a little more complicated these days. I can't tell you how                          nice it is to have a conversation                         with a woman and have the pressure off. Not to mention, a home cooked meal that no one else I know could possibly cook. Jane's not sure if she feels a little hurt by that.   She smiles, wiping the counter. ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a compliment. So you                             don't have a guy in your life at the moment? JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.... (starts to say something.) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake rises from the bushes outside of Jane's Kitchen Wind He PEEKS in the window, balancing himself precariously on stack of loose bricks. He sees Jane telling Adam a story both of them cracking up. Jake leans in further to try to hear what Jane's saying when the bricks slip under his fe he loses his balance and drops OUT OF THE FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane walks Adam to the door.    He holds rolled blueprint

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was so nice and relaxing and the lavender ice cream was actually the best dessert of any sort I've ever had... like, in my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, thank you. I always make ice cream when I can't sleep, so I'm glad someone was here to eat it. (opens door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pauses...)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great getting to know you a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was really fun. Adam waves, Jane waves. Definitely a little sweet/awkward Jane closes her door, starts turning out lights, heading the kitchen, when there's a QUICK KNOCK on the FRONT DOOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woops!   Coming! Jane quickly returns to the door and opens it to find:

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: leaning in the door frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O.M.G. I thought he'd never leave. (entering) Hello Jane, you look very beautiful tonight. He takes her in his arms. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmmm. Love when you smell like butter. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (easing away) What are you doing here? JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Missed you. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nine o'clock. Where does your wife think you are? JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At yoga.   Shall we do some downward facing dog? JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not tonight big guy. They CROSS INTO THE KITCHEN. CAMERA TRACKS. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it really necessary for you to always say no before you say yes? I won't think less of you, you know. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really, Jake, I'm a little tired, I was just gonna take a bath. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. So, we'll just hang out. (now IN THE KITCHEN, he SEES the dinner dishes on the counter) Ooooo, is that Croque-Monsieur? Who's plate is this? Yours or his? JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
