dialogues.text: Mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eats her leftovers, savors the taste)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, just as I remember it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you ever eat at your house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pedro dictates all meals and he has a very limited palate. (sees melted ice cream)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of ice cream is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lavender Honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (immediately)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not sleeping?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all. You?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never slept better. And my                              digestion is finally back on track. You've turned my world right side up, Jane. You know what this means, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That I've never really known how to live without you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane takes a bubble bath. Jake lies on the floor, leaning against the tub, his back to her, eating a bowl of ice cr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should be growing old together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hate to tell you, big guy, but we already grew old apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's with the `big guy'? Is that because you think I'm fat or is it a term of endearment?                         JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea why I keep saying that. I'm sorry. I'll stop. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. (then) I love how quiet it is in your house. I have no quiet in my life. Ever. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, you live with a five              year old. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...and don't forget Pedro. Jane splashes him. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what does that mean exactly...?            What's going on over there at your place? JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My marriage is... not turning out as I hoped. That's obvious.... Agness started out really looking up to me... We never used to fight but now... with the kid....lately we're all about where he's gonna go to school and now she says we need            a bigger house, more help. I was thinking of cutting back at work...           now that's never gonna happen. And            she wants another baby before Pedro gets too old which I get but since we're always fighting... oh, God, listen to me. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't a baby part of the deal when you marry a woman that age?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it? I guess so. She's got me booked at the fertility center every other day and she's so amped up on hormone injections I may need to find an exorcist if she doesn't calm down.                                             (Jane laughs) I wish it was funny. (finishes his ice cream) Incredible ice cream. I'm turning around... (as he turns, Jane shrinks in the tub) Remember when we used to smoke pot and eat your ice cream in the hot tub? JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "hot tub"... That feels like a billion years ago. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long has it been since you...                      (indicates smoking a                               joint)                                            JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?   Since before Lauren was born. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 27 years?!! JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least. Jake slips a joint out of his shirt pocket, twirls it. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me? Put that away!                     It's been too long... JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to....                                   JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, why don't I leave this with                      you... (It's kind of amazing.)                         Maybe you'll take a few hits... (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE(cont'd) get your sea legs, then we'll smoke the rest of it together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake places the joint in a drawer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that nerdy architect likes you...you know that, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not nerdy and he definitely doesn't. We're working together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was watching when you bent down to open the oven, his eyes were glued to your ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (changing the subject)                            Hey, will you do me a favor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake is on a small ladder, changing a light bulb in the chandelier. Jane, in a robe, stands beneath him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking down at her, smiles) Tell the truth, Janey is this a great affair, or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. It's my first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (climbing down) We don't even have to have sex and it's fun. (arrives next to her) I wish I could sleep over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta tell my shrink about this. This is a lot to handle. I guess you should go ... I'm sure yoga's probably closed by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE(cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you got a little ice cream on your shirt. Let me get that out. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay... Jake takes Jane in his arms and gives her a deep hug. He lingers, kissing her neck, smelling her skin. She kisses on the cheek. He slides her robe off her shoulder. He softly caresses her shoulder, kissing it, then makes his up her neck.   Jane gives in and kisses Jake fully on the lips. He pulls her close, her robe falling. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, wow, wow...what's happening, Jake? The Phone RINGS.   Jane pauses. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get it.                                          JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always get it. I have three kids. (Jake wishes she wouldn't. She hesitates, picks it up) Hello. Hiii... (makes an I told you so face) You still on the plane? How was Luke when you left? Oh, that                           sounds like fun. Let me know what I can bring..... No! Don't have                        any idea where he is. (points to Jake) Okay, honey, talk to you tomorrow. (hangs up) Now I'm lying...... Lauren and                         Harley are giving Luke a graduation party this weekend. Sweet, huh? Jake's CELL PHONE RINGS, sees it's Lauren calling. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hello stranger. Welcome back. Jane OPENS THE DOOR and Jake darts over for a quick kiss then EXITS toward his car. They wave to one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Just getting in my car. This                         weekend? Sounds great. Let me know what I can bring... Jake looks to Jane. She shakes her head -- he's shameless Jake shrugs. Jane watches as Jake drives off, talking on cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane paces outside of a medical building, holding a box f her bakery.   She's clearly waiting for someone. She spots a comfortably dressed MAN IN HIS MID FORTIES holding the leash of an Airedale and approaching the building's entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (approaching him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Allen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised to see her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane. Hi. Am I seeing you today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I just need to talk...and I was                     wondering if there was any chance you could squeeze me in for an emergency session. I'm sort of desperate for some advice. I brought you some of that coffee cake you like. Not as a bribe or anything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checks his watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I only have twenty minutes until my first patient.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's fine. I'll talk fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane, Dr. Allen and the Dog walk the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, at this point, I just need some                    sound, unbiased guidance. Is                           having an affair with you know who a good thing or a bad thing? (they stop at Dr. Allen's office door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a bad thing, right? How could it be good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (opening his door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not good. It's not bad. Oh, man.   Not what she needs to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane sits in a chair across from an empty chair.   Dr. Al turns on a few lamps as his dog settles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, things happen in life and                    our job is to find out why. What                       we have to do is take a real look at this. Are you ready to do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am. Definitely. I've made a list                     of what this can possibly be about...at my end. Can I read it to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking his seat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (digging out her                                   Blackberry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. I e-mailed it to myself.                       (reads from Blackberry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Am I still trying to figure out why the marriage failed? Do I want to get back together? Do we have unfinished business? Is this                      about revenge?   Am I just...                          lonely? Or, is it my "caretaker"                       thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE(cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, the kids are finally gone                 and now all of a sudden Jake's back and I get to take care of him in some way... Dr. Allen nods, impressed with the work she's done. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, listen, I get how therapy                      works, I do... We look at things,                   we examine them, weeks turn into months, what....? we're going on                    eight years, right?.... and I'm                     okay with that, I like it... but in this case, I need to know what you really think. Like, I'd like you                    to say... Don't do this, it's absolutely wrong or go ahead, you'll be fine. I actually want to be told what to do. DR. ALLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's interesting is I'm already seeing you open up more than I have in some time. I'm thinking,                         through this affair, you may learn                  to view the world in a different way. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I need more concrete. Are you saying I should keep seeing him? Because, honestly, if the                      guilt and fear could go away, maybe I could let go a little and figure                  this out. DR. ALLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't resist looking at this. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mulls that over quickly)                       Okay... and another way of saying                   that is....? DR. ALLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go Jane. It can't hurt.                         Jane fist pumps in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake is in the Waiting Room with several other "Older" Me all with their much younger Wives.   A Nurse ENTERS, hold a chart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob Adler?                                              Jake rises.   One of the younger women whispers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have fun...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Nurse shows Jake into a windowless room with a sink, pleather barcalounger, a TV and a DVD player.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you know the drill. You can hang your things in the closest, the remote is on top of the TV and the materials are in the drawers. (cleaning the remote with an anti-bacterial wipe)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please deposit your specimen in the cup and I'll see you when you're done. She dims the light before leaving. Jake takes off his jacket, tosses it on the chair, slips his shoes, takes off his pants, sits for a sec when his P RINGS. He looks at the name of the caller. Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on her cell)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want to grab some lunch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely. When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you do it now? I have about an hour. Thought we could go to The                        Stanhope....get room service.                           (she's nervous just saying it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be there in ten!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you there, Adler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hangs up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's comin' back! Jake rushes to put on his pants, catches his foot in the pant's hem, hops to safety. He reaches for his jacket the grabs an anti-bacterial wipe, using it to turn the door k

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harley and Lauren are having lunch in the CAFE connected the Lobby. Harley has a clear view of the Lobby's Recepti Desk. Lauren has her back to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Luke's so excited about his party. We can fit forty people in our place, can't we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, if nobody wants to sit                            down...                                                 (notices JAKE ENTERING the hotel)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Hey, there's your... Harley then realizes JAKE IS signing the Register and CHECKING IN and chokes on his French Fry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My what... (starts to turn)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harley grabs Lauren's face in his hands and kisses her, e though he's choking. He coughs while kissing her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harley!!! HARLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I didn't mean to spit on you. I just needed to kiss you. LAUREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While you were choking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It worked.     I'm not choking anymore. Harley swallows a cough, reaching for his water, HIS EYES JAKE as Jake is HANDED A ROOM KEY and POINTED TOWARD THE ELEVATOR. Harley drinks his entire glass of water as he watches. LAUREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning) Who did you just see? Luckily Jake is now gone. HARLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one. Thought it was your cousin...but... Harley falls silent as he SEES JANE ENTER THE HOTEL AND C TO THE RECEPTION DESK. After a sec, she's pointed toward same elevator. HARLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohhhh my sweet Lord.... LAUREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks up from her salad) Now what? HARLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, I totally forgot I have a conference call at 1:15, I gotta get back to the office. Waiter! Honey, stop eating, get the waiter. Call the one over there. (pointing her away from Jane) LAUREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harley, we can't leave, we're meeting with the Wedding Specialist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (watches as Jake waits for Jane around the corner)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you know what? Today's not a good idea to do that.                                    (Sees Jane join Jake, they                           step into the elevator                              and immediately fall into                           each other's arms and                               kiss)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God...!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The curtains are drawn,   the lights are low. Jane, in a robe, slips a cd in the   cd player and we hear a mellow perfect for love in the   afternoon. The Bathroom Door OP and Jake EXITS, also in   a hotel robe. Jane stands across the room from him. They smile at one another. From behind, we see Jane untie her robe, letting fall to the floor. Jake looks at her, from head to toe an back. They smile at one another, then something comes ove Jake. His eyes roll back, his legs give out and he collap against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hotel's Wedding Specialist has joined Lauren and Harl table. She holds a binder filled with photos. Harley is a mess, knowing what's going on upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I adore October weddings. Let me show you what we did last October. She opens her Book of Photos for Lauren. Lauren gasps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, I'm gonna make that phone call from the... Lauren and the Wedding Specialist don't look up and don't hear him. They keep talking to each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Okay. Good. You just keep doing that and I'll...                                       They still don't look up. Harley nervously HEADS FOR THE LOBBY when he spots the HOTEL DOCTOR, bag in hand, arrivi at the Reception Desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the room number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 408. Adler. His wife said he's                         conscious now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On my way. Harley stops in his tracks, freaking.   Adler???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake is under the covers, in his robe, a blood pressure c around his arm. Jane, still in her robe, paces. The Hotel Doc sits on a chair next to Jake's side of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your blood pressure's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's his heart?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have a heart condition, Mr. Adler?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   And I just had a check up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did?   Oh, that's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (listening to his heart)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deep breath. So, no chest pain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOTEL DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you got dizzy, did you feel your heart was beating funny? JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but I was admiring my beautiful... (indicates Jane) Jane holds up her weak eyelid. HOTEL DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Well that's nice to hear after all these years... (winds up his stethoscope) Did you forget to take any of your medications today? JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Took `em all. HOTEL DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What all did you take?                       JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh....Lipitor, baby aspirin..                (whispers) Flomax. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sitting on the bed) Flomax? JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) Yes, otherwise I pee 40 times a day. HOTEL DOC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have you been taking the            Flomax? JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that long. And I only take it sporadically. I have to sneak it actually. (explains confidentially) It reduces semen and that's not good for my wife right now. (to Jane) Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks over at Jane) Really..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I prefer a lot of semen. Always have. (rises) Okay, well, thank you so much for                    coming. Looks like he's gonna live, so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (packing up) Yeah, my guess is Flomax is probably the culprit here. It can definitely give you a sudden drop in blood pressure so I suggest you stay off it for a few weeks, which apparently your wife will appreciate. (holds in a chuckle)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   Really good for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Doctor snaps his bag shut, rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I suggest you rest quietly for the rest of the afternoon. (to Jane) No hanky panky, Mrs. Adler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No chance. I assure you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harley sits on a bench with his head between his legs. La arrives, joins him on the bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you acting like this because of the wedding? Tell me the truth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (head down) Not at all. Swear to God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I don't want to be one of those couples where the guy goes into a coma the whole time we plan the wedding. It's not worth it to me. Harley looks up, sees the Hotel Doc walk by the Reception Clerk. The Doc gives her a wink and a "thumbs up" and kee on walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deep sigh, rises)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay! We're back in business!

dialogues.speaker: OPRAH
dialogues.text: In Jane and Jake's room.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: Sitting up in bed, in their robes, watching Oprah and eat chicken soup on trays. Jake reaches for the salt. Jane eases it away from him. Jake looks over at Jane, oozing w love and appreciation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See. Just that move...you have no                      idea. Not everyone's like that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mutes Oprah, then:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake, I have a confession to make.                     Back when we broke up... I knew it wasn't all your fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean that?   You've never said that to me before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Because when you cheated,                      I didn't have to. But I think in some way, I gave up on us and I'm not sure you ever really did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still haven't. Jake takes Jane's hand. She looks down at his wedding rin then turns her eyes back to Oprah. A beat, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you and Agness... still having sex? Jake doesn't answer.    Jane turns, looks right at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only if she initiates it. Jane GROANS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying not to rock the boat at home until you and I figure this out. (sees her reaction)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a little trickier at my end than yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Yeah. Okay....                                    (rises...)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I know you're gonna think I'm                        leaving because of what you just                         said, but I'm not. I really have to get back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes Jane's hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got really close there for a moment. She knows he's right. Jane's Cell RINGS.     She lets it again, then answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, hope I'm not interrupting anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam! Oh!     Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake is instantly jealous.   He rises, crosses to the clo starts dressing, his eyes glued to Jane who seems to be v engaged by Adam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just found out there's a French Film Festival in town and that made me think of you so I was wondering if you'd like to go to the opening night tomorrow night. (a little nervous... will she accept?)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that sounds so fun... (Jake rolls his eyes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me think, tomorrow's what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperate, whispers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Say you're busy. Agness has a dinner thing tomorrow, I can come over. (Jane hesitates)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, um, you know, I'd really love to, but, my son is coming home from college the next day and I have a bunch of things I have to do to get ready... (hates lying, Jake crosses to her, smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, don't worry. No problem. Maybe we can see something another night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely. I would love that.                          Jake smiles appreciatively, crosses to Jane, hugs her.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM HANGS UP
dialogues.text: We see he is holding Two Movie Tickets. He looks at them then crosses to the desk of a Female Worker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie, how would you and your husband like two tickets to the opening of the French Film Festival? Reserved seats...VIP parking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane and Jake are finishing getting dressed, moving about putting on shoes, blouses, ties, jackets, belts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll make the whole thing?    The roast chicken, the---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- mashed potatoes, sauteed string beans and double fudge chocolate                          cake. I know your favorite dinner, Jakey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (touched)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't called me Jakey in 10 years. This has been a great day for us. So, do we have a date?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fixes Jake's hair)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a date.                                           Jake grabs his heart. Jane leans on him, a smile on her f as we begin to HEAR MUSIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music plays from the outdoor speakers. Jane sets the tabl her courtyard. She's singing along with the music.

dialogues.speaker: A PERFECT CAKE
dialogues.text: sits on the Kitchen Counter. Jane finishes off icing the cake like the pro she is then peeks into the oven, looks her perfect roast chicken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane clips the price tag off of a new dress and slips it its hanger.

dialogues.speaker: A CLOCK ON A NIGHT STAND
dialogues.text: tells us it's 8:45.

dialogues.speaker: ON JAKE
dialogues.text: His eyes glued to the clock. We are IN JAKE AND AGNESS' BEDROOM. Jake and Agness lie on their bed, both doing pap work. Pedro is asleep between them. Jake gets up, slippin his cell into his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not looking at him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you taking your cell to the bathroom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Didn't mean to. (places it back on the night stand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carry him to his bed, will you? Jake carefully lifts Pedro off the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (while reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And hurry back. I'm ovulating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you think I cancelled my dinner? Agness pulls her t-shirt over her head... she is gorgeous

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake gently lies Pedro in his bed, pulls up the covers. P takes Jake's hand, holds it to his chest, looking up at h Jake offers a comforting smile and Pedro closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake sits on the bed and lets Pedro fall back asleep, hol onto his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Candles are lit on the table, but are now low. The table set with flowers from the garden. The wine has not been opened. CAMERA CRANES to FIND Jane INSIDE THE KITCHEN, st dressed for dinner and deep in thought. She then sighs ve deeply and decisively as she turns out the lights and roo room, the house becomes dark. 76   EXT. JANE'S HOUSE - THE NEXT DAY - 6 P.M. The Kids cars are in the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane, Gabby, Lauren and Harley are in the kitchen, cookin setting the table, opening wine, chatting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Oh, Mom, I keep forgetting to                        tell you about our meeting at The                       Stanhope. We went there for lunch                       two days ago and met with their                         Wedding Specialist....I think that                      could be the place, Mom....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two days ago you went to The                            Stanhope...for lunch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes and guess what?    We saw                           nothing.                                                Jane and Harley connect.    He immediately looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who wants wine? Anyone?                                 (starts pouring)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking in the fridge)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, you have an insane amount of food in here, even for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking out last night's roast chicken) I knew you were all going to be here for the weekend so I made a bunch of stuff last night. LAUREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like Jake Adler's favorite meal to me. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) Very funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very.                                                  Jane looks to Harley again when they all hear a car horn HONK. Jane LOOKS OUT THE WINDOW and sees JAKE'S PORSCHE P UP with Luke in the passenger seat. The Girls rush out th Kitchen door. Harley sees Jake getting out of the car and pours himself a larger glass of wine as Jane approaches h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harley?                                                Just then, Luke enters and Jane lights up. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yay!!!! (hugs Luke) LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surveying all the food) Mom, this looks amazing. Harley and Luke hug, talk the talk. `Sup? Yo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sheepishly joins the group, eyes on Jane)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (briskly) Hey. Harley takes a huge gulp of his wine. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding Luke's backpack) Where should I put this...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns her back on him, making herself busy) Wherever. Harley watches their interaction tennis match style. Jake looks at the table set for five, wishes he was joining th He sees last night's dinner, now being served as left ove Jane slices the roast chicken. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That looks incredible.                                 Jane looks up at him, knife poised.    Is he kidding? JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. She goes at the chicken with the knife, slicing off a leg Jake flinches. HARLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake?   Glass of wine? JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, sure.    Thanks. HARLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane? JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not looking up) No thank you. Jake's cell RINGS.    He turns his back to take it. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into cell) Hi Ag... Just got here. Jane has a hot flash.    Starts fanning herself. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into cell) Okay, I will. Yeah, no, I know. (turns back to the family) I'm sorry guys, I gotta hit it. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye-bye. The Girls look to Jane.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: I have to stop at the market. Agness is making some pasta thing and she ran out of olive oil.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: Hey, at least she's finally cooking.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: So...see everybody at the party tomorrow...

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: Yeah.   It's gonna be so fun.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: (to Lauren) I told you I'm bringing someone, right?

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN
dialogues.text: No. Who?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Adam.   My architect.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: You're bringing your architect?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Yes I am.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Like as a date?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: (looking right at him) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: I like the idea.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Me too.

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: Yeah, seems like it should round out everything really nicely. (pouring another drink) Nobody wants wine but me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke opens a cupboard, takes out a bottle of olive oil, h it to Jake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, now you can stay another five minutes. (catches Jane's eye)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have three bottles in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janey, can I talk to you privately? Just for a sec. Jane heads out still holding the carving knife.   Harley the knife out of her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you go.... (to Kids)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody's talkin' graduation gift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane and Jake stand in the courtyard off of the Living Ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, Jake?   What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get not calling me back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Cause I don't care what your excuse is. (shuts the door to the living )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't go out, Jane. She cancelled her plans and every time I tried to call or write, she caught me. I wanted to be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what, Jake? You were worried about rocking the boat at home? Well now you're rocking my                         boat and I don't like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stopping her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, don't let one night...

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: You don't understand. I'm not even blaming you. I fully participated in this. But I don't want to do it anymore. The last thing in the world I should be right now is your mistress, sitting around at nine at night wearing heels and perfume and blowing out candles and wrapping everything in Saran Wrap because your wife cancelled her plans. It was cliche and humiliating.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: (wistfully) You lit candles?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Oh, shut up. Look, I've had a pretty good life these past 10 years. I figured it out and I moved on. I no longer feel alone or divorced. I just feel normal. You know how long that took, just to get my balance back?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: The point is, I'm going in the wrong direction here. But the worst part is... It's feeling like it used to feel. All the little untruths that are hard to catch but add up...

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: -- Janey, c'mon, it was one mistake...

dialogues.speaker: HARLEY
dialogues.text: (joining them) -- Everything okay out here? (Jane and Jake turn) The kids are gettin' hungry...

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Yeah. We're done. (walks away, pauses in front of Harley) We were just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as she passes) -- None of my beeswax, Jane. (once she's gone) And please never tell me. Lauren joins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up? JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin', punky. (rubs her arm) LAUREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking Jake back inside)                            Yeah? So, we're going to see you                         tomorrow night, for sure, right?                         Harley starts to follow them out when Jane grabs his shir sleeve. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay...What did you see and what do                      you know?                                                HARLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Really.                                         Jane gives him a look that could get blood from a stone. HARLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confesses rapidly)                                  Okay, he checked in, you arrived,                        you met in the elevator, possible                        kiss there, Doctor went up, Doctor                       came down, thumbs up. That's it.                         Have no idea what happened in                            between.                                                 JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dying...)                                           Have you told Lauren?                                    HARLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No and I won't --                                        LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (joining them)                                       Mom. Dad's leaving...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane and Harley ENTER from the courtyard just as Jake is about to leave. Jane immediately crosses to the table whi now has dinner on it. Lauren kisses Jake good-bye on the cheek then joins the others who are about to sit down for dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the Dining Room)                            Thanks for picking me up, Dad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake pauses awkwardly at the door. He can't catch Jane's eye. He waves to the kids, who don't seem to notice then heads out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake EXITS, turns back, looks INSIDE THE DINING ROOM, see his family sitting around the table, talking, laughing. H heads toward his car as...

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: glances out the window at Jake as he drives off. One of t kids says something, distracting her, and she laughs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harley and Luke, on ladders, are stringing paper lanterns across a small patio. Lauren crosses under them, carrying tray of food and joins Gabby who is setting out drinks.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BATHROOM
dialogues.text: Jane sits at her dressing table, dressed for the party. S puts on hoop earrings -- likes the way she looks. She ope a drawer to take out a lipstick.

dialogues.speaker: THE DRAWER
dialogues.text: Sitting among her cosmetics is the joint Jake left for he She looks at the joint, then looks at herself in the mirr

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: He looks adorable and carries a gift the size of a book. knocks in a playful rhythm.

dialogues.speaker: JANE ANSWERS THE DOOR
dialogues.text: all smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey....

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: Very happy to see her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.   You look fantastic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm feelin' a little fantastic. She OPENS THE DOOR A LITTLE WIDER and we NOW SEE she's ea a gi-normous piece of cake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying not to react to that, ENTERS, handing her the gift.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Thank you! Come on in. (takes a huge bite of cake)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you hold this for a sec? (hands him the cake plate)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God... (takes another bite)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- this could be the best cake I ever made. You want a piece? It's like... beyond...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'm good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (focusing on the gift)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you brought me a gift?! So nice!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane unwraps the gift, turns it around, looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An appointment book?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sort of assumed you didn't have one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Because I never remember our... Awww....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took the liberty of filling in our next two meetings. And marked them with post-its and wrote them in red and then highlighted them in neon yellow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you! Jane kisses Adam on the cheek just as he was moving and t kiss lands on his lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not. (Did he really say that? Then, he licks his lips)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, that cake is good. Jane laughs a little too hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, let me ask you something and please don't think I'm weird or out of line or anything... but do you by any chance poke smot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean do you smoke pot?! I haven't asked anyone that question since I was twenty-two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh. No, I don't. But I have. But I don't think I've had any since my kids were born...so not in like 27 years. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, we have kids the same age! And I haven't had any since my kids were born either!!! Except for tonight. I had one hit off of this. Jane pulls the joint out of her purse, just as they pull next to a Police Car. ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might not want to hold that quite so... (nods) Hello Officer. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns, SEES the Cop Car, GASPS and DROPS THE JOINT, then TURNS to Cop, waves, then:)                                    I actually know him! Blueberry scone and a latte. (the Cop nods, pulls away) Oh my God! That was horrifying. I instantly saw myself in a mug shot. My heart is leaping out of my... (then distracted) Wow... This is the most insane dashboard I've ever seen. It's like we're in a cockpit. It's spectacular. Adam, what kind of car is this? ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane? JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns to him) Hi. ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get this high from one hit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! I don't know what they've                            done to pot over the last 30 years but it rockkkkks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From OUTSIDE, we can see lots of folks in the Living Room Candles dot the path up to the cottage door. Several Coup and College Kids are walking toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND NEARBY BUSHES
dialogues.text: Jane and Adam are sharing the joint.   Jane takes a tiny, like hit, passes it to Adam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't take too much, it's really strong. She blows out the smoke. Adam, on the other hand, takes a huge hit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (while holding in the smoke)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't had fun in almost three years, Jane. (takes another huge hit)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring. It. On.

dialogues.speaker: SOME COLLEGE KIDS
dialogues.text: walk past the bushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's got the reefer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fake falsetto)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one. Keep walking please. The Kids laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane and Adam, two very straight laced grown ups, ENTER t party, pausing as they peruse the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Totally fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam starts to move to the music insanely well and then j insanely. Lauren and Harley greet them. Jane greets them back with a huge hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi... love your dress.   Hey Harls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (that's weird...) Harls...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam, this is my oldest, Lauren and her fiance, Harley.                                    (giggles to Kids) We're on a date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam and Jane stifle laughs.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BAR
dialogues.text: Jane and Adam chat with all the Kids.     Looks like it's great -- Adam is a big hit.

dialogues.speaker: ON JAKE
dialogues.text: Jake nurses a drink and is not looking happy. He sees the Kids disperse, finishes off his vodka, ready to make his move.

dialogues.speaker: ON JANE AND ADAM
dialogues.text: Now alone.    They haven't seen Jake yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starts moving to the                              music - Jane laughs)                              By the way -- How great is this party? Let's be the last to leave.                     (bops to the MUSIC then

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROOM, seriously eyeing him.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM(cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, there's your ex-husb-- Uh-Oh.                      He's headed right toward us. Not                        the time to be "feeling groovy"                         (dances again when he sees                          Jake in SLOW-MO getting                            closer and closer) Oooo. Why so intense, big fella? Adam slides a bit behind Jane as Jake arrives with Agness looks inappropriately youthful. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Jane.... Adam. ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (all smiles)                                        Hey, good to see you again. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam, this is Agness, Jake's wife... (suddenly realizing) Now that is an odd sentence for me to say since that was me for most of my life. Seriously. How weird is that? Both of us married to the same man! AGNESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dismissing the idea) You know... it's... hey, what are                       you gonna do? JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, why go there. At this point, Adam gets hit with a severe case of the giggles. As the rest continue, he can't keep a straight face. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because there, is...fascinating. I mean, when you think about it, it sort of links us in some cosmic                         crazy way, doesn't it, Agness? Of                       all the men on the planet, we both said "I do" to this guy. AGNESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Twenty-five years apart. I know you're having like an "Ah-Ha' moment, but I think I'm gonna get a refill. Adam, good meeting you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers to Jane as                                  Agness exits)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's got a really scary tattoo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janey, can I talk to you for a quick sec? Jake nods his head toward the bathroom and heads for it. looks to Adam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He always needs me for a quick sec. (starts to exit)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm very okay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane and Jake are crammed into an extremely tight space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?    You're acting insane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers giddily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm stoned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! You smoked the joint I gave you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told me to!    It's a-mazing!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you weren't supposed to smoke it with him, you're supposed to smoke it with me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody's jealous....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, of course. Why shouldn't I be... you're my...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- What?   What am I, Jake? JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're my ex-wife, lover, oldest friend and girlfriend. Jane blurts out a laugh. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. You're hilarious. And because of that, even though I kind of hate you/love you, I'm going to let you have some... JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You love me? I mean, I heard "hate" had top billing, but... Jane takes the joint out of her purse, lights it up and h it to Jake. Just as she does that, THE DOOR OPENS and HAR ENTERS, thinking the bathroom is free. Jake quickly yanks him in, shuts the door, locks it. Harley is now caught between Jane and Jake and a cloud of smoke. HARLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, you're smoking weed in the guest bathroom. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes we are and we'd appreciate it if you didn't tell anyone about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Never.     Adding it to the list.                   JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Care for a toke? HARLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't really smoke marijuana. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blowing out smoke) Me either. HARLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, one hit. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at herself in the mirror) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE(cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God. Is that what I look like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small group is dancing to a hip hop song on the patio. Adam and Agness are dancing together. They're totally int it. Jane makes her way to the dance floor as the song end and The Beach Boys "Wouldn't It Be Nice" begins. Jake follows Jane dancing his way toward the crowd, spinning G on his way. Jake takes Jane's hand...dances with her. Harley arrives next to Lauren and Gabby who watch their parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They must be hammered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or something like that. Adam glances over and sees Jane and Jake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Agness)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweetest divorced couple in the world..! Agness is surprised by how happy Jake looks with Jane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (spotting Adam)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey..! (to Jake)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake, I'm gonna....                                       Jane and Adam cross toward one another. Jake dies a littl as Jane leaves him, her eyes on Adam. Jake doesn't notice Agness is watching him.. Jane, now dancing with Adam, loo from Adam to Jake then back to Adam and then doesn't look back at Jake again. Jake is still as he watches the woman he loves slip away. Agness has her eyes firmly on Jake, not missing any of it

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Adam drives Jane home.   Clearly the end of a great night

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Fun is not overrated, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what's great?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much I like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (really touched)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you... I really like you a lot too.... even though...oh.. you                      didn't say, "a lot".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I was thinking it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... I'm not too old for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you be too old for me when I'm older than you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just figured all these women you get fixed up with are thirty-five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your age is one of my favorite things about you. (she appreciates that)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think you have any more of that chocolate cake at your house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hungry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starved!

dialogues.speaker: A BLACK SCREEN
dialogues.text: And we are IN THE BAKERY at ONE A.M. Jane turns on a few more lights, but keeps it a bit moody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officially now the best date of my life. Pre or post divorce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out... All right....so basically I can make you anything on the menu or even not on the menu. Just name it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?  Really? Okay.                                       (scans the blackboard                                menu)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about a... warm chocolate croissant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My speciality!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE FLOURS AND ROLLS CROISSANT DOUGH as Adam, now in an apron, watches, chatting with her. Jane then places the dough in a machine called a Sheeter. The dough slides int the sheeter and then slides back out bigger and flatter.

dialogues.speaker: JANE AND ADAM
dialogues.text: watching the sheeter, mesmerized. NEXT Jane folds the flattened dough, measures it with a y stick, then cuts it into sections. She takes one of the sections, spreads it on a marble slab and very quickly cu it into triangles. She's a whiz at this. THEN, Jane shows Adam how to stretch the triangles of dough.... Nervous at first, he gets the hang of it. Then, Jane teaches Adam how to place a bar of chocolate in each triangle and roll it into a croissant. Laughing as they work, they make a dozen croissants... NEXT...into the OVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane and Adam sit at a table in the corner, a stack of croissants piled high between them. Music plays as Adam takes the top croissant and Jane takes the next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bites into it) Oh. Baby. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smelling hers) Mmmmmmmm. ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's crazy how good this is. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (biting into one, nods) Yeah, and I'm not even stoned anymore. ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither am I. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (happy about that) Oh, then...merci, Monsieur. ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you remember when I asked you the other night, if you were dating anyone and you said no... It sounded to me like you were maybe saying yes. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was sort of seeing someone.     But, it's over now. (Adam nods) Honestly. ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Cause I'm not strong enough to fall for someone who's with someone else. Wouldn't be able to take that again. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand. I wouldn't say it was over if it wasn't. Adam takes Jane's hand in his...relieved. ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.                                            Adam turns Jane's hand over and looks at it a bit quizzically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (explains) Cooking scar.... From a very hot batch of caramel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooooo. What about that one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That one's from boiling sugar...I wasn't very skilled in the beginning.    And that one is from a large French...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam presses Jane's palm to his lips and kisses her scar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Saute pan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam then kisses the burn on her forearm. Jane sighs, clo her eyes. This feeling is unexpected. She opens her eyes Adam moves closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would it be okay if I...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane nods.    He kisses her great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was going to say, kiss you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figured.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you feel this is in any way wrong because we're working together...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I don't ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles as she folds into him and they kiss and kiss an kiss again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet. Jane enters from the garden, humming, "Wouldn't It Nice." Luke ENTERS, still looking half asleep in his T Sh and boxers. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey sleepy! What time did you get in? LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have no idea. Lauren and Harley drove me home. LAUREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (joining) I'm surprised you remember that. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns to see Lauren) Hi. I didn't know you slept here. Lauren, in an open robe over drawstrings and a tank top, takes out a box of cereal. LAUREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were playing Scattagories with Gabby and Ollie then Harley fell                         asleep on the couch. Harley meanders in wearing Victoria Secret Heart patterne bottoms and a Girl's V-neck T-shirt. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet. HARLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got cold in the middle of the night. Lauren and Jane laugh. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, who wants what? (noticing Gabby entering)                            Hi baby...                                               GABBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks out the front                                 window)                                             What's Dad doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone LOOKS OUT THE WINDOW and SEES Jake sitting in hi Porsche.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane EXITS as Jake steps out of his car. He looks like he had a rough night and has something on his mind. Jane cautiously looks back at the house. The kitchen windows a all open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I left Agness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, don't say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She saw it my eyes, Janey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saw what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That I'm still in love with you.   I admitted it, I told her about us and I've left her. For you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no.... What do you mean??? Jake, this is crazy! (worried the kids will hear, whispers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you telling me the truth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This feels so right Jane. As Jane is about to respond, Gabby EXITS the house in her PJ's, looking confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the porch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Honey, set the table, I'll be right in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, you're the only one who cares if the table's set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, then do it for me....just go in please. Luke and Lauren join Gabby on the porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up, Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Having some problems on the home front, just wanted to talk to your Mom for a sec. Jane shakes her head.    Why did he have to say that?   H joins the Kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Problems on the home front?   Is one of you seeing someone else? Hearing that, Harley does a swift about face and goes rig back inside. Jane's eyes widen toward Jake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off Jane's cue) No, it's nothing like that. I just need to find a hotel or something for a few days `til I get my head together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's that serious? Jake nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, can Dad stay here for a few days? He can share my room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think that's the best idea, Luke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, are you crying?

dialogues.speaker: ON JAKE
dialogues.text: He turns away from the kids.   The tears could be for dra effect, could be real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. All Three Kids immediately well up and look at Jane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (begging)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane nervously nibbles on her fingernail as the family si silently around the table watching a ravenous Jake eat Fr Toast, bacon, coffee, side of fruit. His mood has been lifted. His energy is in full bloom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy's the best cook in the world!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane is working in the garden. A shadow falls over her. looks up, Jake stands before her, a cute smile breaking across his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for saving me Janey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake, you knew the kids were all here. Shouldn't we have talked about this? Agreed this was the right thing to do? This is so typical. Only thinking about works for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I guess I should've called before showing up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- And I'm not sure you even left Agness. Maybe she saw something last night and threw you out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the difference? I was drowning over there. I'm not going to get that many more chances in my life to figure myself out. Janey, let's use these couple of days to see if we can make this work. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't, Jake. I told you this the other night. Please listen. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you were all pissy because you thought I stood you up. Things are different now. I'm a free man. (then) Can we just hug? I hate that you're being so distant. It's literally giving me a pain in my stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God... Jane reluctantly hugs him.      He tries to kiss her. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See!    Too much! JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay!    Good note. Jane can't help but smile. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help with what you're doing? Hold your basket or... JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.... JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... I'm going to go to the video store and get us all a dvd to watch tonight. We'll have movie night. Just like old times. How's that? I'll make the popcorn.                           Just then Jane's Cell RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love knowing I'm coming back here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods, turning slightly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hi... I slept great. How `bout you? Jake waits, but realizes Jane's not going to turn back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Adlers are watching The Graduate. The lights are low. Jake, shoes off, hands everyone bowls of popcorn. Jane si in a club chair. Harley's on the floor and the Adler Kids are on one long sofa, all covered in a blanket. Jake hand them popcorn then squeezes back in, between the Girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you here for an affair, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Singleman party, sir? Jane cringes as the Kids laugh. She looks over at Jake snuggling between the Kids, all eating popcorn and laughi He catches Jane's eye and mouths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake, bare legged and wearing a robe and slippers, crosse the KITCHEN where he finds Luke and Gabby digging through fridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any leftovers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? (takes out an armful of Tupperware)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any of that noodle thing left? (Gabby hands it to him.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Mom? She disappeared so fast after the movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's probably sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think she's on her computer. They all nibble out of Tupperware, leaning against variou counters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight was weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So weird. Still is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I loved tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. That's why it was so weird. Just seeing you in your robe in our kitchen. Remember when you weren't even allowed in. Mom used to go out to the car to talk to you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing Gabby his                                  Tupperware)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I don't even really remember you and Mom as a couple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean... you were ten when we broke up. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was eight actually and I don't know...it's all foggy to me now. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't remember us in Hawaii or all sleeping in that tent in the backyard. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, of course, but I don't remember like you and Mom hugging or waking up together... Jake grabs his heart, moans. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- It's okay. I'm not damaged or anything. You've been good parents... GABBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speak for yourself dude. I'm definitely damaged from the divorce. Harley and Lauren ENTER.   Lauren turns the tea kettle on LAUREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello troops. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you still here? LAUREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, you and Mom sleeping in the same house. Harley thought we should stay. Jake turns his beams on Harley. HARLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She exaggerates. I just thought perhaps you might want to talk later, or ... Is that the noodle thing? JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Sorry. I think I ate it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know anyone wanted any.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane, sits on her bed, talking to Adam via iSight. On her LAPTOP SCREEN, we see Adam but he's a bit of a BLUR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, I can't see that one.    Can you back up a little?

dialogues.speaker: JANE'S LAP TOP SCREEN
dialogues.text: He back ups from the lens and models a rather ridiculous sweater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hmmm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very festive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O-kay. Thank you. (into lens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gift from my ex-sister-in-law. Have no idea why I kept it. (pulls sweater off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Into the pile. Hey, check out the pile, Jane. Adam POINTS HIS LAPTOP to the floor to show a HUGE STACK OLD CLOTHES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice! (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, the pile's moving....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy, get out of there! A small Mutt scurries out of the pile.   Jane laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re-enters in an odd shirt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about this?   I was in India and I had it made.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM(cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy ran out of fabric so he didn't make me long sleeves. (looks down) Or short sleeves. It's weird. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And kinda girly. ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking it off) Not what I'm going for. (holds up a sweater)                              Gray sweater. Very old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But cute. ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slips it on) You sure? You don't have to say you like it just because you nixed the last 20 things. Jane likes this man. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep it. It's cozy.   Boy, you have a lot of clothes. ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at the floor) Uh, not anymore. Okay, we're almost done. You are helping me so much by the way. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Adam, I really have to pee. ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh good. Me too. Meet you back in thirty.... (lifting the laptop) Putting this on my desk....

dialogues.speaker: ON JANE'S SIDE
dialogues.text: Just a shot of Jane's Pillows on her bed. JANE'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not in there... ON ADAM'S SIDE - AN ISIGHT FRAME OF AN EMPTY DESK CHAIR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't hear you.

dialogues.speaker: SAME TIME
dialogues.text: Jake pokes his head in, looks around, sees no one in the room. He hears Jane in the bathroom and ENTERS quietly, quickly squirms out of his boxers and T-shirt, then, DROP HIS ROBE, and lies on his side, on the bed, completely NU elbow up, palm supporting his head -- a smile on his face changes his smile to a smoulder. Jake hears water running. Suddenly modest, he quickly dra over the open Laptop and places the open screen in front his privates. He smiles, ready to be discovered.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: A104   dries her hands at the bathroom sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam crosses through the room on his way to his laptop. 105    JANE ENTERS HER BEDROOM, SEES JAKE and lets out a Simultaneously, ADAM PLOPS DOWN IN HIS DESK CHAIR, LOOKS HIS SCREEN and instantly YANKS HIMSELF AWAY in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother of -- (looks again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhhhhhhhhhh!!!! Jake LOOKS DOWN AT THE SCREEN,    SEES ADAM'S SCREAMING F AND SCREAMS BACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing in here?!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (covering the screen with his hands)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get it off!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (covering himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you naked!?! JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sits up straight, the lap top shooting even more directly at his groin) Why do you think? ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'm gonna be sick. Jake LEANS IN, covers Adam's eyes on the screen, which, o course, does nothing. ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not working! Big close up! Jake rises, now his ass gets the close up, he bends over get his robe. ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay!   Good night! Jake SPINS THE LAPTOP and the ISIGHT LENS LANDS ON JANE. Jane and Adam look at one another. No time to say anythin She's desperate. He's lost. The DOOR FLIES OPEN, the KIDS RUSH IN, just as Jake ties robe. GABBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody okay? No one says anything. LAUREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening? Adam listens, his eyes on Jane. Jake crosses to Jane, fac the Kids. He walks in and out of the iSight shot. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Let me explain. The reason I left Agness wasn't just because my marriage wasn't working. (The Kids wait...) I've also fallen in love...back in love... with your mother. Or maybe I never stopped loving her. GABBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this a joke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know this is shocking, but I think this is the best thing that's ever happened to me. Your Mom and I have been seeing each other, on the side... ever since New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, is this true?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dying)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That part is, but..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found my way back home.     I just hope she'll take me back. Gabby breaks down in tears.    Lauren puts her arm around Jane starts to cry, looks at her laptop, just as she HEAR CLICK and THE LAPTOP SCREEN GOES BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why's everyone crying?     Why isn't this good news?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because we're still getting over                         the divorce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, are you and Dad getting back together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... we're not. Jane looks at the Kids with incredible sadness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Kids, in their cars, drive down the road, away from t house. Jane stands in the driveway, watching, never befor feeling quite like this. Jake EXITS THE HOUSE, holding hi bag. He stops, looks at Jane. She has nothing left to say Jake gets in his car and pulls away as Jane walks back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane lies on a pool chaise, wrapped in a blanket, tissues hand. She stares up at the night sky and as her eyes flut shut, we drift off of her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA DRIFTS ACROSS THE POOL TO JANE, asleep on the pool chaise, still wrapped in a blanket. The sprinklers go off and wake Jane. She opens her eyes, looks around, realizes she's spent the night outside. Jane sits up too fast, a tad disoriented, then quickly realizes what she must do.

dialogues.speaker: A FRONT DOOR OPENS TO REVEAL HARLEY
dialogues.text: bed-headed and still in his pj's. He approvingly looks at Jane, who stands across from him, ready to right it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glad you're here, boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harley leads Jane down the narrow hall to the Bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I know you don't need my advice                       Jane, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got this one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you do.                                            Jane pauses, Harley nods for her to go inside.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Her Three Kids are under the covers. Lauren is between Ga and Luke. They look like they just woke up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane stands in the doorway. The Kids don't say a word. Ja doesn't wait. She crosses to the bed, sits on it, looks a her children. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knowing how to be divorced is next to impossible... and sometimes over the years, I've thought that your Dad and I weren't quite finished. And, as it turns out, we weren't. So I went out of my comfort zone, which, I found out, if you're really honest with yourself, isn't all that comforting. So, I experimented with a part of myself. I wanted to find out if, after all these years there was still something there between us. LAUREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And was there? JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There kinda was. Lauren smiles with her eyes. GABBY
