dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Mom, you have to understand how bonkers this sounds to us. For two people who for years couldn't be in the same room together...to then have an affair??? You and Dad...! JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know...it was hard for me and I was doing it. I hope you'll forgive me for confusing you or betraying your trust, but I did this for me and for him and I realized even though your Dad and I once had something extraordinary... we no longer really fit together. But he is a part of me and always will be. LUKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it's over now? You guys are back to being divorced. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For better or for worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lauren takes her Mom's hand. Harley joins them, sitting o the other side of the bed, holding back tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Group hug? And as they all move into hug, we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVERSE ON JANE walking through Adam's firm.    She arriv

dialogues.speaker: ADAM'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: Adam is on a phone call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah no problem...we can definitely do that... (notices Jane)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- James, can I call you back, someone just... Thanks. (rises)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. May I come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't call you last night                              because I wasn't sure you would take the call and then I thought that could go on for months and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I would have taken the call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Well, anyway, it's better to say these things in person. Adam, the man I was seeing was...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'm up to speed on that part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to know it didn't last long and you're divorced, so maybe you understand, when marriages end, there's doubts and hurt, and you've got kids and sometimes you wonder if you did the right thing and when the moment presented itself... ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I get it. I could imagine it...I could... JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told him it wasn't going to work between us but I guess he didn't believe me and unbeknownst to me, he showed up at my house yesterday. He left Agness and... ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Jane. I actually think I understand what happened but...uh...you know I'm not as macho as I appear and I think it's probably best for us not to get any more... involved because your relationship with Jake isn't really done and I know you're saying it is, but he's in love with you and for everyone's sake, that should probably get resolved. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.   So that's how grown ups talk. Adam smiles. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please tell me you're not going to quit my job and ask Peter to take over because then I'll never get to see you and... ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking of asking Peter to step back in. JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... I hope you don't... ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane drives home, when she notices Jake's Porsche in her driveway. She gets out of her car, finds Jake sitting on bench swing hanging from a large oak in the front yard. Jane crosses to Jake. He moves over. Jane sees the humor this gesture and sits on the swing with him, letting out sigh. Side by side, they swing in the late afternoon bree

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Jane doesn't answer right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How far back does that sorry go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How far back do you need it to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Consider it an all inclusive apology. From not being the husband you needed to showing up nude on your bed last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, what were you thinking with that move?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That you'd find me irresistible. Jane turns to him, her eyes warming up to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never considered the alternative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta love that about you. They swing some more.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Oh, man, can't believe I got up to bat again and blew it.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: You didn't blow it. We blew it. We blew it the first time around. This time... we just should've known better. Too much has happened. Too much time has passed.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: And you don't think we could make it right?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Does that mean you didn't feel it was totally right either?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Being with you Jane is the best I'm gonna be.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: But do you agree that it wasn't really...?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: It was complicated.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Begging for an answer.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: I thought it was good.   I wanted it to be good.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Guess that's as close as I'm gonna              get.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Do you always have to be so hard on me?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: No.   I don't.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: I don't regret giving it another shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably would've been better if you hadn't been married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It may never have happened if I wasn't married. Jane looks at Jake, knowing how true that is. They sit, s by side, as they sway in the breeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't regret it either. They continue rocking, not much more to say.   As CAMERA AWAY, we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's raining. Trucks are pulling into the driveway as lum is being taken off of a truck and covered in tarps. Jane EXITS THE HOUSE in a parka and under an umbrella. A GROUP OF CONSTRUCTION GUYS ARE huddled under a make-shift tarp. Jane crosses toward them and as the group opens to face her she spots Adam, holding blue prints. Jane is stunned he's there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know it's good luck to start building in the rain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (obviously lying)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. It's a well known, very good, really lucky omen. Thunder rattles the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up) Good, I could use one. (then) Would you all like to have your meeting in the house...it's dry and I've got hot coffee... The Group thanks her and heads for the house. Adam stays back and walks next to Jane. It's a long second before someone talks. ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane, I need to ask you                                 something...                                            JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything...                                             ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't happen to have any of                      those amazing chocolate croissants, would you? JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.... you like those, huh?                             ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have incredibly fond memories of                      them.                                                   JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have any here, but we could                     go into town and get some... right                      out of the oven.                                        They turn toward the house and on their backs we hear: ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to do that?                                    JANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... love to.                                        And as they walk away from Camera, we:
